metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12418 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Manipulating individual parts of a URL object could have caused an out-of-bounds read, leaking process memory to malicious JavaScript. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.10, Firefox < 78, and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12418` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
